content: Just remembered that we should discuss what streams are the default on here.
Yeah, I've had it on my to do list for a while to hold a kind of "draft zulip guidelines" meeting
I think we need the following:
• An "explainer" teaching people how to use Zulip
• We can link to the explainer
• It can show how to subscribe to new streams, and give a general overview of our "stream structure"
• We can then have a relatively small default set of streams
• Although I'm also fine having all streams by default, and having people opt-out :)
• The explainer should also clear up whether we consider it "polite" to subscribe people to streams when cc'ing them; my answer would be "yes, if you want an answer from them; no otherwise"
We should post that message as a compiler team issue.
indeed
(any other things to add on there?)
I imagine it'd be good to post up a draft and let people make suggestions
I can't think of anything right now.
I'd sort of rather this be distinct from compiler-team per se -- although we're the main users, we're not the only ones...
one thing we could mention is that many people choose to use their Github name instead of their Real Name
I would go so far as to say this could be encouraged :)
